alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Mercer; Nelson; Shelby; Spencer; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 8:21PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Spencer, southeastern Shelby, northeastern Nelson, Mercer, Woodford, Anderson, Washington and southwestern Franklin Counties through 845 PM EST... At 821 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Taylorsville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Shelby, Mercer, Woodford, southwestern Franklin, southeastern Spencer, Washington, northeastern Nelson and Anderson Counties, including the following locations... Mackville, Wayside, Booker, Dugansville, Anderson City, Glensboro, Polin, Farmdale, Johnsonville and Croakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Louisville.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Mercer; Nelson; Shelby; Spencer; Washington
